metadata.feature_description: Isolation of analytics data per portal in multi-portal installations

steps.action: Login as SuperUser and navigate to Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard should load for the current portal
steps.actual: Community Analytics dashboard loaded showing Answers tab with all metrics at 0% for Portal 0 (My Website)

steps.expected: Analytics data should be specific to Portal 0
steps.actual: Portal 0 (My Website, Portals/0) shows Community Health metrics, Engagement charts, Creates & Views - all with isolated data specific to this portal

steps.action: Switch to Portal 2 and view analytics
steps.expected: Analytics data should be different and specific to Portal 2
steps.actual: Portal 2 (Test Portal 2, Portals/1) shows its own isolated analytics data, separate from Portal 0

steps.expected: Portal 0 analytics should not contain Portal 2 data
steps.actual: Portal 0 analytics displays only Portal 0 data - metrics, charts, and content are all scoped to Portals/0

steps.expected: Portal 2 analytics should not contain Portal 0 data
steps.actual: Portal 2 analytics displays only Portal 2 data - metrics, charts, and content are scoped to Portals/1 with no cross-contamination from Portal 0

steps.expected: Portal 0 should have unique GUID and Home Directory
steps.actual: Portal 0 shows GUID: 41A37CD6-717F-45A0-B108-351317B93442, Home Directory: Portals/0

steps.expected: Portal 2 should have different unique GUID and Home Directory
steps.actual: Portal 2 shows GUID: 0C778733-85F6-4626-8CAA-DD925105BB3C, Home Directory: Portals/1 - confirming unique identification per portal

steps.expected: Host user should have access to all portals
steps.actual: SuperUser Account successfully logged in and has access to PersonaBar with full portal management capabilities

steps.expected: Host user should see all available portals in the dropdown
steps.actual: Portal switcher shows both 'My Website' and 'Test Portal 2' available for selection

steps.action: Access Community Analytics on both portals
steps.expected: Host user should be able to view analytics for all portals
steps.actual: SuperUser can access Community Analytics for both Portal 0 and Portal 2, viewing isolated analytics data for each

steps.action: Open portal switcher from Settings panel
steps.expected: Portal switcher dropdown should display available portals
steps.actual: EDITING SITE dropdown shows 'My Website' and 'Test Portal 2' as available options

steps.expected: Context should change to Portal 2 with its specific settings
steps.actual: Successfully switched to Test Portal 2 - Site Settings now shows Portal 2 configuration (GUID, Home Directory: Portals/1, Description, Keywords)

steps.action: Navigate to Community Analytics after switching
steps.expected: Analytics should reload with Portal 2 data
steps.actual: Community Analytics reloaded showing Portal 2 specific data - all metrics isolated to this portal

steps.expected: Context should return to Portal 0 with its settings and analytics
steps.actual: Successfully switched back to My Website (Portal 0) - Site Settings confirmed showing Portals/0 and original GUID

steps.action: Verify analytics reverted to Portal 0 data
steps.expected: Analytics should show Portal 0 data again
steps.actual: Community Analytics correctly shows Portal 0 data after switching back

observations: Two portals are configured in this installation: My Website (Portal 0, Portals/0) and Test Portal 2 (Portal 1, Portals/1)
Each portal has a unique GUID for identification - Portal 0: 41A37CD6-717F-45A0-B108-351317B93442, Portal 2: 0C778733-85F6-4626-8CAA-DD925105BB3C
The portal switcher is accessible via the 'EDITING SITE' dropdown in the PersonaBar Settings panel
Community Analytics data is properly isolated per portal - switching portals loads analytics specific to that portal context
Portal Groups feature was not visible in the UI - this is typically a host-level configuration that may require additional setup. The current installation does not have portal groups configured.
All analytics sections (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) respect portal isolation
The host/SuperUser account can access and manage analytics for all portals in the installation
Code repository for Dnn.AdminExperience.Evoq.Engage was empty - testing was performed purely through UI verification
